intro: Primulina nana, commonly known as the dwarf primula, is a low-growing evergreen perennial native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It features rosettes of thick, waxy, dark green leaves that are often variegated with silver or white markings. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in the spring and early summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is well-suited for indoor cultivation or as a houseplant. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is popular among collectors and gardeners seeking a compact, easy-to-care-for plant.
